conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to use the properties of angles and triangles involved in the wedge-shaped glass and understand the relationships between the angles and the refractive properties of the wedge.
The top angle of the wedge is 30 degrees, and the angle of incidence is 45 degrees.
Since the angle of incidence is 45 degrees, the angle of refraction is also 45 degrees, making triangle ONS an isosceles right triangle with angle ONS = 90 degrees.
The light-emitting part on the edge is equal to the side of the triangle opposite the 30-degree angle.
Using the properties of the triangle, the side opposite the 30-degree angle is equal to the side opposite the 45-degree angle, which is (1/sqrt(2)) * 30 = 15.
The ratio of the length of the light-emitting part to the edge is 15/30 = 1/2.
